intro: Filago castroviejoi, commonly known as the Castroviejo's filago, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Filago castroviejoi is considered a species of conservation concern.
